comment_text: J
13:23

So, sonic booms don't happen because it goes from subsonic to supersonic, or from supersonic to subsonic. They happen when something GOING supersonic passes such that its sound waves reach you all at once. Ironically something travelling directly away from you (as the rocket basically is when it takes off,) is always "streaming" sound waves at you (loud ones at that - frickin' ROCKET sound,) so you don't hear the sonic boom. You've been inside the "sound cone" the whole time.

Coming BACK though, it left where its sound waves could reach you (space,) and when it came back, it was going supersonic. So all of the sound it had been putting out (mostly just wind noise) gets all bunched up and hits you all at once. *BOOM*!
So it takes off, leaves the satellite in space and comes back all in Like 15 min? Can someone explain it to me please
